meanings.definition: Having been declared invalid or nullified.
meanings.sent1: The voided ticket was no longer valid for entry.
meanings.sent2: The contract was voided after both parties agreed to cancel it.
meanings.sent3: The voided stamp made the envelope unusable.
meanings.sent4: Her voided apology left him feeling empty and unappreciated.
meanings.sent5: The voided warranty meant she had no protection for her new phone.

meanings.sent1: She voided the trash from the bin into the dumpster.
meanings.sent2: The plumber needed to void the clogged drain to fix it.
meanings.sent3: He voided his plate quickly, eager to leave the table.
meanings.sent4: The storm voided the beach of all its visitors.
meanings.sent5: The magician voided the hat of any hidden objects before the trick.

meanings.sent1: The dark voided of the cave made her shiver.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted the voided in the center of the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The voided in the room seemed to swallow all sound.
meanings.sent4: The voided in his heart grew larger with each disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The voided in the forest was a place of mystery and fear.
